snippet: The deal had compromises from both sides, with the unions agreeing to their first pay cut in decades and management abandoning its toughest demands and agreeing to make significant reductions of its own.
abstract: Metropolitan Opera and unions representing its orchestra and chorus reach tentative deal, agreeing to significant and somewhat surprising cuts; orchestra and chorus agree to first pay cut in decades, and management abandons its toughest demands and agrees to make significant reductions of its own; Met still must complete negotiations with other, smaller unions.
lead_paragraph: The deal had compromises from both sides, with the unions agreeing to their first pay cut in decades and management abandoning its toughest demands and agreeing to make significant reductions of its own.

headline.main: In Surprise Finale at Metropolitan Opera’s Labor Talks, Both Sides Agree to Cuts
headline.print_headline: In Surprise Finale at Metropolitan Opera’s Labor Talks, Both Sides Agree to Cuts
